children.text: Good things are happening! The congressional staffer sit-in pushed Democratic leadership and the Senate to reopen negotiations on a significant climate spending package. As activist and philosopher Olúfẹ́mi O. Táíwò

Solar Power Is Cheaper Than Ever
Between 2010 and 2020, the cost of solar power has

! According to climate change writer David Wallace-Wells, the cost of wind and battery power has fallen almost as much, while the fracking industry lost $300 billion in profits. Wallace-Wells noted that, “the viability of green energy creation has never been greater,” with the International Energy Agency announcing that “global investment in clean, green and renewable technologies [has] exceeded investment in fossil fuels for the first time, accounting for more than $1.4 trillion of the total global investment of $2.4 trillion.”
The rest of Wallace-Wells’ piece provides critical commentary on fracking and a green transition.

The Second Largest Redlining Settlement In U.S. History
. The investigation found that lenders in the Philadelphia area were not making mortgage loans as readily available to borrowers of color as they were to white borrowers.

This week, Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro announced a settlement of more than $20 million with the former top home mortgage lender, Trident Mortgage Company. “The deal requires Trident to provide individual subsidies of up to $10,000 in support of new mortgages for owner-occupied homes in majority-minority neighborhoods to qualified applicants.”
Workers at Trader Joe’s in Hadley, Massachusetts, voted on Thursday to unionize. It is the first Trader Joe’s location out of 500 to win a formal union.

Los Angeles Proposes Ban On New Gas Pumps

Los Angeles could be the first major city in the U.S. to ban the construction of new gas stations as it considers how to make a green energy transition. Los Angeles City Councilmember Paul Koretz, who drafted the policy, said in a

, “We are ending oil drilling in Los Angeles. We are moving to all-electric new construction. And we are building toward fossil fuel-free transportation.” If approved, the measure would prevent additions to the 600 gas stations already in Los Angeles county.

The People vs. Fossil Fuels climate justice coalition is organizing an action: “Join a national day of action on August 2nd to demand that Biden declare a climate emergency and reject fossil fuels!* Actions can be big or small: the important thing is that we do them together and direct our demands at President Biden. We'll provide advice and support to help make your event a success. If you want to host an action but can't do it on August 2nd, aim for another day that week!”
